game

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Board

  • public class Board
extends Object
    The Board class contains a 2D array of squares, making up the conceptual board. Additionally the class has an integer 'size' defining the maximum size of the board, as well as a list of ship which contains the 'Ships' that have been placed on the board.
    Author:
    tolaakso

      • placeShip

        public boolean placeShip(Ship ship,
                int x,
                int y)
        placeShip(ship,x,y) method places a ship to a point (x,y). The method checks for out of bounds points. It assumes that the given point is the highest point of the ship (of a given size) if the ship is set vertically, or the leftmost point if the ship is horizontally and checks the location accordingly. Additionally the method makes sure that the squares onto which a new ship is trying to be placed does not already contain a ship.
        Parameters:
        ship -
        x -
        y -
        Returns:
        - true if a ship is place successfully. False if the given point (x,y) is out of bounds, ship can not fit the board, or an existing ship is already under the new ship.
